member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Push.CheckLaunchedFromNotification(Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.LaunchActivatedEventArgs)
member.summary: Call this method at the end of Application.OnLaunched with the same parameter as OnLaunched. This method call is needed to handle click on push to trigger the portable PushNotificationReceived event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Push.ApplyEnabledState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If enabled, register push channel and send URI to backend. Also start intercepting pushes. If disabled and previously enabled, stop listening for pushes (they will still be received though).

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Push.OnChannelGroupReady(Microsoft.AppCenter.Channel.IChannelGroup,System.String)
member.summary: Method that is called to signal start of the Push service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Push.IsEnabledAsync
member.summary: Check whether the Push service is enabled or not.
member.returns: A task with result being true if enabled, false if disabled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Push.SetEnabledAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable the Push service.
member.returns: A task to monitor the operation.

member.name: E:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Push.PushNotificationReceived
member.summary: Occurs when the application receives a push notification.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Ingestion.Models.PushInstallationLog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PushInstallationLog class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Ingestion.Models.PushInstallationLog.#ctor(Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PushInstallationLog class.
member.param: The PNS handle for this installation.

When tracking an analytics session, logs can be part of the session by specifying this identifier. This attribute is optional, a missing value means the session tracking is disabled (like when using only error reporting feature). Concrete types like StartSessionLog or PageLog are always part of a session and always include this identifier.
optional string used for associating logs with users.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.Ingestion.Models.PushInstallationLog.PushToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the PNS handle for this installation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.PushNotificationReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Event args for event that occurs when a push notification is received.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AppCenter.Push.PushNotificationReceivedEventArgs.CustomData
member.summary: Custom data attached to the push message.
